1.title: Day 1
1.plot: 12 Celebrity Big Brother contestants are isolated from the outside world for 26 days in a custom built house. Watching over these Housemates is Big Brother - heard only via a voice. He is the all-seeing all-knowing authoritarian figure who monitors the Housemates' every move. Every week Housemates nominate each other for Eviction in a secret ballot. The viewers then vote to decide who will be Evicted. The last person left is the winner.

2.title: Day 2
2.plot: Celebrity Big Brother, based on the original Big Brother series, is a British reality game show in which a number of selected celebrities, referred to as housemates, live in isolation from the outside world in a custom built "house" for up to four weeks, constantly under video and audio surveillance. The last remaining Housemate is declared the winner.

3.title: Day 3
3.plot: A group of celebrity Big Brother contestants enter the Big Brother compound and must compete against each other for a chance to win a cash prize in a house wired with cameras and microphones, capturing their every move for a TV and Internet audience. The last remaining Housemate is declared the winner. The series runs over 26 days.

4.title: Day 4
4.plot: Celebrity Big Brother is a reality television show made in the UK, where 12 celebrities take part in a challenge to see who will last the longest in the purpose-built Big Brother house. Monitored by cameras and microphones 24/7, the winner will take home a large cash prize while the losers take home nothing.

5.title: Day 5
5.plot: A group of celebrities share a house sealed from the outside world for 26 days. Watching over these Housemates is Big Brother - heard only via a voice. He is the all-seeing all-knowing authoritarian figure who monitors the Housemates' every move. Every week Housemates nominate each other for Eviction in a secret ballot. The viewers then vote to decide who will be Evicted. The last person left is deemed the winner.

6.title: Diary Room Uncut: Week One
6.plot: A group of celebrity housemates living together in a special custom-built house are filmed 24 hours per day, watched by the public. All housemates must remain in the house at all times, and avoid being evicted by viewers of the show with the aim of being the last remaining housemate at the end of the series and declared the winner.

Housemates are under the control of Big Brother, a rule enforcing authority figure who monitors their behaviour and sets tasks and punishments. Housemates must avoid being nominated for eviction by each other and then evicted by viewers of the show with the aim of winning a substantial cash prize at the end of the series.
